sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: Clearing for Results Phase III (CFR-III) looks to build on the success of Phase II. The CFR program is implemented by the UNDP through the Cambodian Mine Action and Victims Assistance Authority (CMAA), who administer a tendering process for mine-clearance contracts. The program also provides some capacity development and support for the CMAA, which is a peak body responsible for monitoring and coordinating mine action activities within the sector. The total value of this investment is $9.0 million over 5 years, starting 2015-16.
